Notes: NEGAHC collects objects and archival materials relating to the history of the northeast Georgia Appalachian region. There are two permanent exhibits: Land of Promise, a look at the history of the region from the time of the Cherokee, settlement, the Civil War, the growth of industry, the two world wars, and the massive growth and diversification of the area since 1945; and a tribute to Ed Dodd, creator and artist of the Mark Trail series of comics. There is also a small display of area pottery and a changing exhibit space. On our property we also have two historic structures (both relocated): the cabin of Cherokee Chief White Path and a rural blacksmithÆs shop.
